title: Virginity, Fidelity, and Fertility
teaser:
A special live edition of The Moth at Town Hall in NYC with Garrison Keillor, with additional hosting by Jay Allison. A woman describes how her father’s risky entrepreneurial endeavors kept her close-knit Southern family in flux; world renowned conservationist and field biologist Alan Rabinowitz makes a life-changing friendship while studying the Taron tribe of the Himalayas; and a woman raised as a Mormon is terrified that her parents will disown her when she confesses that she has left the faith. 

The Moth Radio Hour is produced by The Moth and Jay Allison of Atlantic Public Media.
contentencoded:
Tina McElroy Ansa is a little girl when her father’s business goes under and her family must leave their beloved, expansive home.

Alan Rabinowitz treks through the Himalayas to study the Taron, a dying race of people, and makes discoveries about himself.
 
Elna Baker must tell her Mormon parents that she has made an irreversible change in her life.
